Dear Sdt
’fien the Executive Committee met in Minneapolis in January
to appoint committees, it sometimes had difficulty in deciding
exactly what each committee was to do. Communications from
committee members and chairmen have indicated doubts on their
part too. Therefore, I think we should set up a little handbook
in which the areas of responsibility for each committee are defined.
If well done, this should facilitate the work of committees during
my administration, at the same time that it provides guidance
to subseouent officers and committee members.
I should prefer to do this through exchanges of correspondence
with the committees rather than by a unilateral statement, how¬
ever. Time makes it impossible for me to write letters to every¬
body immediately but I am trying to go through the committees on©
by one, and some correspondence with Frank about the Publications
Committee, together with the preliminary study of HAEB periodicals
turned out by Glenn Hansen and Theodore Peterson, provide me with
a spring board to write about the Publications Committee.
It seems to me that the main function of the Publications
Committee is setting the basic policy to be followed by the
several NAEB publications, that is, the Newsletter, and the Journal.
To this end, I think the Hansen-Peterson study provides a certain
amount of guidance, though it doesn* t answer what seems to me is
the basic Question! what is to be the relationship between the
Newsletter and the Journal on the on© hand, and all the other
publications about the mass media on the other? Hie purpose of
the Newsletter has always seemed rather clear to me. As its title
Indicates, it is a means of providing an exchange of news among
members of the organization. It is a sort of house organ for an
organization.
